summary: A chapel player-home seamlessly added to the city of Morthal. JK's version compatible!
descriptionHtml:
[center][color=#00ff00][size=6]~Morihaus Chapel~[/size][/color][/center][center]

For a town that has a graveyard, but no hall of the dead, Morthal was a bit of an oddity but still very attractive place in Skyrim! I'm still not off my want for a good chapel to call home, so I made one here with Dragonborn and Hearthfire resources. And it's Adoption Friendly!

A worn-down and unused Chapel of Talos sits on the riverbank next to the Morthal town bridge, partially redecorated to serve as a home. Its previous tenant was exiled during the first Thalmor inquisitions, and left abandoned in Morthal for fear of Aldmeri retribution. The chapel has many weapon racks and displays, 2 mannequins, an oven and alchemy/enchantment tables. No staff enchanter or smithing amenities; JK's Morthal is compatible.
It has Hearthfire assets that make it compatible with the Multiple Adoption mod (3 beds, and really only bedrolls), hopefully keeping the atmosphere that the building was not originally intended as a home. Ah, but there's plenty of wine!

[img]http://i.imgur.com/QHsTDXI.gif[/img]

Fully navmeshed and TES5Edit cleaned!

I was tempted to make a dungeon to go along with it, but that might come in a later version; It's a busy summer.
[color=#ff0000]
Requirements:[/color]
- Hearthfire
- Dragonborn
[color=#ff0000]
Installation: [/color]
- One .esp, no extra files to go along with this one. Painfully vanilla.

[color=#ff0000]Incompatabilities:[/color]
- Town overhauls that edit the Morthal07 exterior cell; such as ones that give Morthal big town walls.[/center]
author: ClefJ
